triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper applies machine learning algorithms as the core methodology for thyroid disease prediction.

triples.name: Thyroid disease
triples.relevance: Thyroid disease is the medical condition being predicted by the machine learning models in this study.

triples.name: Blood test
triples.relevance: Blood tests are used to detect thyroid disease and provide the data for the machine learning algorithms.

triples.name: Artificial neural network
triples.relevance: The ANN Classifier is proposed as the best-performing algorithm with F1-score of 0.957 for thyroid risk prediction.

triples.name: Precision and recall
triples.relevance: Precision and recall are evaluation metrics used alongside accuracy and F1-score to assess model performance.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: The F1-score is used as the primary evaluation metric for handling class imbalance in the thyroid disease dataset.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: The Sick-euthyroid dataset used in the study is from the UCI Machine Learning Repository.

triples.name: Oversampling and undersampling in data analysis
triples.relevance: These techniques address the class imbalance problem present in the thyroid disease dataset.
